Growing up in a quirky family, Rebel (née Rebellette) was always drawn to the world of comedy. Her parents, a former circus performer and a punk rock musician, encouraged her creativity and stage presence from a young age.

After dropping out of school in the 9th grade, Rebel began working odd jobs around town, including waitressing and singing in a cover band. She eventually attended the Sydney Actors' Centre, where she honed her craft and discovered her love for improv comedy.

In the early 2000s, Rebel began performing stand-up comedy in small clubs and bars around Australia, quickly gaining a reputation for her sharp wit, physical comedy, and endearing stage presence. She went on to co-found the Australian comedy troupe "The We've Got Talent Gang," which toured the country, entertaining audiences with outrageous characters and sketches.

After moving to Los Angeles, Rebel began landing small roles on TV shows and in films, including a stint as a writer and producer on the hit web series "The Lizzie Bennet Diaries." Her breakout role came in 2011 with the film "Bridesmaids," where she played the unforgettable character of Brynn, the lovable but eccentric bridesmaid.

Since then, Rebel has gone on to star in numerous films, including "Pitch Perfect," "Isn't It Romantic," and "Cats," as well as appearing on popular TV shows like "Superstore" and "How I Met Your Mother." She has received numerous award nominations, including a Golden Globe nomination for Best Actress in a Motion Picture – Comedy or Musical.

Throughout her career, Rebel has used her platform to advocate for mental health awareness, women's rights, and LGBTQ+ representation in media. Off-screen, she is a passionate philanthropist, supporting various charitable organizations, including the Australian Children's Hospital and the LGBTQ+ organization GLAAD.

Despite her success, Rebel remains humble and true to her roots, often crediting her quirky upbringing and Australian upbringing for her unique comedic style. She continues to entertain audiences around the world, inspiring a new generation of comedians and performers to take the stage.
